alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Hempstead; Lafayette; Nevada; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 11 at 10:13AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Louisiana, including the following counties and parishes, in Arkansas, Columbia, Hempstead, Lafayette, Nevada and Union. In Louisiana, Bienville, Bossier, Caddo, Caldwell, Claiborne, De Soto, Grant, Jackson, La Salle, Lincoln, Natchitoches, Ouachita, Red River, Sabine, Union, Webster and Winn. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms resulting in heavy rainfall can be expected through late Thursday afternoon with an additional 2-4 inches of rainfall with isolated higher totals in excess of 5 inches possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
